resources.string: The personality questionnaire, which is designed to diagnose the type of character accentuation, is the implementation of a typological approach to its study.

string.name: create_account
string.u: I want to create an account

resources.string: Do you want to take the test?

1. Demonstrative type. It is characterized by an increased ability to repress, demonstrative behavior, liveliness, mobility, ease in establishing contacts. He is prone to fantasy, falsehood and pretense aimed at embellishing his person, adventurism, artistry, posturing. He is driven by the desire for leadership, the need for recognition, the thirst for constant attention to his person, the thirst for power, praise; the prospect of being unnoticed burdens him.

2. The stuck type. He is characterized by moderate sociability, boredom, a penchant for moralizing, taciturnity. Often suffers from imaginary injustice towards him. In this regard, he is wary and distrustful of people, sensitive to insults and upsets, vulnerable, suspicious, vindictive, experiences what happened for a long time, is not able to "easily move away" from insults.

3. Pedantic type. It is characterized by rigidity, inertia of mental processes, heaviness on the rise, long experience of traumatic events. He rarely enters into conflicts, acting as a passive rather than an active party. At the same time, it reacts very strongly to any manifestation of disorder. In the service, he behaves like a bureaucrat, making many formal demands to others.

4. Excitable type. Insufficient controllability, weakening of control over drives and impulses are combined in people of this type with the power of physiological drives. He is characterized by increased impulsivity, instinctiveness, rudeness, boredom, sullenness, anger, a tendency to rudeness and abuse, to friction and conflicts, in which he himself is an active, provoking party.

5. Hyperthymic type. People of this type are distinguished by great mobility, sociability, talkativeness, expressive gestures, facial expressions, pantomimics, excessive independence, a tendency to mischief, lack of a sense of distance in relationships with others. They often spontaneously deviate from the original topic in conversation. They make a lot of noise everywhere, they love the companies of their peers, they strive to command them. They almost always have a very good mood, good health, high vitality, often blooming appearance, good appetite, healthy sleep, a tendency to gluttony and other joys of life.

6. Dysthymic type. People of this type are distinguished by seriousness, even depression of mood, slowness, weakness of volitional efforts. They are characterized by a pessimistic attitude to the future, low self-esteem, as well as low contact, taciturnity in conversation, even taciturnity.

7. An anxious type. People of this type are characterized by low contact, a minor mood, timidity, timidity, self-doubt. Children of the anxious type are often afraid of the dark, animals, afraid to be alone. They avoid noisy and lively peers, do not like excessively noisy games, feel a sense of shyness and shyness, they are hard going through tests, exams, checks. They often hesitate to answer in front of the class. They willingly submit to the guardianship of their elders, adult notations can cause them remorse, guilt, tears, despair.

8. Cyclothymic type. It is characterized by a change of hyperthymic and dysthymic states. They are characterized by frequent periodic mood swings, as well as dependence on external events. Joyful events cause them pictures of hyperthymia: thirst for activity, increased talkativeness, leap of ideas; sad - depression, slowness of reactions and thinking, their manner of communication with people around them also often changes. In adolescence, two variants of cyclothymic accentuation can be found: typical and labile cycloids.

9. The exalted type. The bright feature of this type is the ability to admire, admire, and also - smiling, feeling of happiness, joy, enjoyment. These feelings can often arise in them for a reason that does not cause much uplift in others, they easily become delighted with joyful events and in complete despair – from sad ones. They are characterized by high contact, talkativeness, amorous.

10. Emotive type. This type is related to the exalted, but its manifestations are not so violent. They are characterized by emotionality, sensitivity, anxiety, talkativeness, fearfulness, deep reactions in the field of subtle feelings. The most pronounced trait is humanity, empathy for other people or animals, responsiveness, soft-heartedness, joy in other people\'s successes.

We offer you to take a character accentuation test, or a Schmishek questionnaire, and find out which types of accentuation are most pronounced in you. As the name of the test implies, the questionnaire was developed by Shmishek on the basis of the dominant character traits identified by Leonhard for a particular type. This accentuation test consists of 88 questions concerning 10 types of accentuations.

You will be offered statements concerning your character. Answer without hesitation for a long time, you can choose one of two answers: "yes" or "no", there are no other answers. You need to click on your answer, after which you will have a button to go to the next question
Enter your email and we will send a new password to your email
The password must be longer than 8 characters
Enter the old password and the new password 2 times
